Submodules#

GS_interface.lib.library_GS module#

Library aimed at scripting Srt with Antenna pointing mechanism

@LL

GS_interface.lib.library_GS.AzAlt2Gal(az, alt)#

Converts AzAlt coordinates to galactic

GS_interface.lib.library_GS.AzAlt2RaDec(az, alt)#

Takes the star coordinates azimuth and altitude as input and transforms them to Ra Dec coordinates.

:param obs_loc an instance of the class EarthLocation containing the informations about the location of the observator :param coords an instance of the class SkyCoord with coordinates corresponding to the input coordinates of the function :param altaz another instance of the class Skycoord but with the original coordinates transformed to the corresponding altitude and azimuth :param coords_altaz string containing the Azimuth in the first position and Altitude in the second position. Both as decimal numbers

class GS_interface.lib.library_GS.BckgrndAPMTask(ser)#

Bases: BckgrndTask

Virtual class aimed at making parallel tasks on APM easier

setSer(ser)#

Sets the serial port over which to communicate

class GS_interface.lib.library_GS.BckgrndTask#

Bases: Thread

Methods :

stop() : turns the stop flag on, allows to kill the thread when writing the run() method in daughter classes

pause() : turns on flag off. allows to pause the thread in run()

unpause() : turns on flag on

pause()#
stop()#
unpause()#
GS_interface.lib.library_GS.Gal2AzAlt(long, b)#

Converts galactic coordinates to AzAlt

class GS_interface.lib.library_GS.QTracker(_mode=TrackMode.RADEC, tle=None, parent=None)#

Bases: QThread

Slot triggered when SRT is ready for next tracking motion

turnOn()#
GS_interface.lib.library_GS.RaDec2AzAlt(ra, dec)#

Takes the star coordinates rightascension and declination as input and transforms them to altitude and azimuth coordinates.

:param obs_loc an instance of the class EarthLocation containing the informations about the location of the observator :param coords an instance of the class SkyCoord with coordinates corresponding to the input coordinates of the function :param altaz another instance of the class Skycoord but with the original coordinates transformed to the corresponding altitude and azimuth :param coords_altaz string containing the Azimuth in the first position and Altitude in the second position. Both as decimal numbers

class GS_interface.lib.library_GS.SerialPort(adress, baud, timeo=None)#

Bases: object

Class aimed at representing the interaction with the APM serial port

connect()#
disconnect()#
listen()#

Reads last message from SerialPort with appropriate processing

send_Ser(msg: str)#

Sends message msg through the serial port.

Returns answer from SerialPort.

class GS_interface.lib.library_GS.Srt(adress, baud, timeo=None, parent=None)#

Bases: QObject

Class that supervizes interface btw user and Small Radio Telescope

calibrate_north(value=990000, verbose=False)#

Defines offset for North position in azimuthal microsteps EPFL current estimation : 990000

connectAPM(water=True)#

Connects to serial port

disconnectAPM()#

Disconnects from serial port

empty_water()#

Moves antenna to a position where water can flow out then goes back to rest position after a while

getAllCoords()#
getAlt()#

Getter on current Altitude in degrees. In case of error returns -1

getAz()#

Getter on current Azimuthal angle in degrees. In case of error returns -1

getAzAlt()#

Getter on current pozition in AltAz coordinates

getDec()#

Returns current Dec

getGal()#

Returns current long/lat in galactic coords

getPos()#

Returns current RaDec in degrees

getRA()#

Returns current RA

go_home(verbose=False)#

Takes SRT to its home position and shuts motors off

obsPower(duration, intTime=1, bandwidth=1.024, fc=1420, repo=None, obs=None, gain=480)#

Observes PSD at center frequency fc for a duration in seconds with integration time of intTime. Bandwidth and center frequency fc are indicated in MHz OBSOLETE : uses library rtl-sdr

observe(repo=None, name=None, dev_args='hackrf=0,bias=1', rf_gain=48, if_gain=25, bb_gain=18, fc=1420000000.0, bw=2400000.0, channels=2048, t_sample=1, duration=60, overwrite=False)#

Launches a parallelized observation process. SRT’s methods are still callable in the meanwhile

Read SRT.__observe() docstring for more information.

onPingSignal()#
onTrackerSignal(az, alt)#
pauseTracking#
plotAll(repo, name, calib, n=20, m=35, f_rest=1420405751.7667, vlsr=False, dB=True, meta=False)#

Plots full display of data using virgo library’s virgo.plot function

pointAzAlt(az, alt, verbose=False)#

Moves antenna to Azimuth and Altitude coordinates in degrees

pointGal(long, lat, verbose=False)#

Moves antenna to galactic coordinates in degrees

pointRaDec(ra, dec, verbose=False)#

Moves antenna to Right Ascension and Declination coordinates in degrees

returnStoredCoords()#
send_APM(msg: str, verbose=False, save=True)#

Utilitary function aimed at sending arbitrary messages to the pointing mechanism via serial port.

Returns answer from APM. Saves it in apmMsg attr if save flag is on

standby(verbose=False)#

Goes back to zenith and switches off motors

staticMetaObject = PySide6.QtCore.QMetaObject("Srt" inherits "QObject": Methods:   #5 type=Signal, signature=trackMotionEnd()   #6 type=Signal, signature=pauseTracking() )#
stopObs()#

Brute force kills the observation process

stopTracking()#

Stops tracking motion

trackGal(long, b)#

Starts tracking given sky coordinates in Galactic mode

trackMotionEnd#
trackRaDec(ra, dec)#

Starts tracking given sky coordinates in RaDec mode

trackSat(tle)#

Starts tracking given a satellite TLE

untangle(verbose=False)#

Go back to resting position, untangling cables

waitObs()#

Waits for the observation to finish. Should only be used in command line; GUI must get rid of this another way round I guess…

GS_interface.lib.library_GS.TLE2AzAlt(tle, delay=0)#

Returns az and alt position of sat at current time given TLE

class GS_interface.lib.library_GS.TrackMode(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)#
